newsitem.title: UK: LME copper edges higher in evening session.
newsitem.headline: LME copper edges higher in evening session.

text.p: London Metal Exchange (LME) copper was indicated a touch higher on Thursday evening following a quiet kerb session when it held above the $2,300 level.

At 1800 GMT three-month copper was bid at $2,306 a tonne, $4 up on the kerb close which was down $5 from Wednesday. But given strong resistance between $2,310 and $2,320 the market looked set to test the downside again, dealers said.
Aluminium, which failed to clear $1,600 despite an LME stock fall, was indicated at $1,586, unchanged from the kerb close.
